faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Frequently asked questions about Base64 and Excel conversion

what.question: What is Base64 encoded Excel file?
what.answer: Base64 encoded Excel file is an Excel binary file converted to Base64 text format for easy transmission and storage in text environments.

why.question: Why do we need Base64 and Excel conversion?
why.answer: In scenarios like API transmission, database storage, email sending, Excel files often need to be encoded to Base64 format for processing.

formats.question: Which Excel file formats are supported?
formats.answer: Supports mainstream Excel file formats like .xlsx, .xls, and complex Excel files with multiple worksheets.

limit.question: Are there file size limits?
limit.answer: No file size limits. All conversions are performed locally in your browser without uploading to servers. Processing speed depends on your device performance.

safe.question: Is the conversion process safe?
safe.answer: Yes, all conversions are performed locally in your browser without uploading to servers, ensuring data security.

preview.question: What are the limitations of the preview feature?
preview.answer: The preview feature limits display to first 100 rows and first 20 columns to ensure page performance. Complete data can be viewed by downloading the file.
